title: SEC Taps Academic to Oversee Mutual Funds Amid Push for Stricter Rules
sub_head: Law professor William Birdthistle is set to run the agency’s division of investment management
body:
WASHINGTON—The Securities and Exchange Commission tapped law professor William Birdthistle to serve as its top regulator of asset managers Tuesday as it prepares to issue stricter rules for money markets and private funds.
Mr. Birdthistle has taught since 2006 at the Illinois Institute of Technology’s Chicago-Kent College of Law, where his research has focused on investment funds, executive compensation and corporate governance.
